treatment.reference: Sulfophobococcus zilligii gen. nov., spec. nov. a Novel Hyperthermophilic Archaeum Isolated from Hot Alkaline Springs of Iceland System Appl Microbiol 20:102-110
treatment.description: Regular or slightly irregular cocci (3-5 µm diam.) with a tuft of filaments, which are 40 µg in length. Growth between 70° and 95°C at neutral to slightly alkaline pH values. Strictly anaerobic, fermentative growth. Growth inhibited by elemental sulfur. Membrane lipids consist exclusively of dibiphytanylglycerol tetraethers. Respiratory lipoquinones are absent. No murein. DNA G+C content between 54 and 56 mol%. Tends to form higher aggregates and adsorb to amorphous particles in the medium. Optimal growth at 85°C, pH 7.5. Strictly anaerobic fermentative growth on yeast extract. Unable to grow on peptone, starch, casamino acids, glucose, ethanol, acetate, xylan or cellulose. Growth inhibited by elemental sulfur. DNA G+C content: 54.7 mol% (Tm). 16S rDNA sequence analysis: Habitat: hot alkaline springs of Iceland. Type strain: strain K1, deposited at the DSMZ under the number DSM 11193. Resistant to chloramphenicol, streptomycin and rifampin.
